# Stroke Prediction with Machine Learning

## Introduction

-   Strokes can be a deadly medical condition, and even if the patient survives there can be life long consequences as a result of the stroke.

-   This is why we wanted to look into a dataset that may allow us to help predict the risk factors that cause a stroke.

## Dataset

-   The dataset used is from a study published in China in 2020. It represents a case group of individuals who had a stroke, and a control group of those who did not.

## Data

-   The dataset included observations like age, gender, marital status, and employment status, as well as medical information such as BMI, glucose levels, smoking history, etc.

::: {#loaddata .cell execution_count=4}

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

   stroke
```

## Data

-   The dataset includes variables such as gender, smoking status, employment status, and marital status which are qualitative variables.
-   Other variables such as age, BMI, and glucose index are all quantitative.

# **Methods and Results**

## EDA

-   Missing values were dropped from the dataset and categorical variables (gender, marital status, work type, residence type and smoking status) were transformed into factors.
